column4: I'm moving from Windows to Unbuntu, though I am having troubles.. can someone help me.
I need to install it from USB stick, but im not sure how to put the ISO on it so it is bootable..
Does anyone know how to do this, so I can install ubuntu?
do you have a windows box lying around?
http://pendrivelinux.com has bat files
that will download the iso, unpack it, and make your drive bootable
you can also use UNetBootIn, which is additionally multi-platform and supports TONS of distros/versions, but i've found that the pendrivelinux bat files work more reliably from windows
format the stick to fat32
download the proper bat file for ubuntu 8.10 to your desktop, and run it
it'll download the iso to your desktop, unpack it, move it to your flash drive, then make your drive bootable

if you're on Vista with UAC enabled, making the drive bootable will fail- after it's all done, then navigate to the drive, manually, right click on "makeboot.bat" and click "run as administrator." it'll tell you to do this.
use this
http://www.pendrivelinux.com/usb-ubuntu-810-install-from-windows-non-persistent/
it's 8.10 instead of 8.04 :) unless you wanted LTE. the first link under "Step One" is the only thing you need to download, it'll automate the rest for you

8.10 is the newest stable release. 8.04 is "long-term support edition", which will have technical support for a garunteed 3 years. if you intend to upgrade to newer versions as they're released, LTE (8.04) is nothing more to you than "an old version"
I used mint for ~1 month, didn't like it much
it felt like Ubuntu with a sack over it's head.
use this one -- http://www.pendrivelinux.com/usb-ubuntu-810-install-from-windows-non-persistent/
have you partitioned your disk for dual booting yet? or is vista taking up the full thing?
i'd advise against trying to resize the NTFS drive, i just did that yesterday and wound up hosing my vista install
Glad to help, good luck!
